授業目的: The objective of this course is to understand how culture affects the way we communicate. The focus will be on raising awareness of the relationship between culture and our values, attitudes and behavior. The course will investigate the different factors that influence people's communication. Students will be expected to first reflect on their own culture and communication styles and then make comparisons with those of other cultures. Understanding comes not only through cognitive and academic study, but also by being aware of our own emotional reactions. Thus, there will be a strong focus on experiential learning and reflective practice.
到達目標: Students will become more aware of their own culture and communication styles. They will gain a deeper knowledge and understanding of the essential nature of cultural differences. They will learn about unconscious and hidden factors of intercultural communication. They will be able to articulate their findings in a clear and objective way. They will learn that emotional responses are equally important and need not be avoided.
授業方法:
1. This course will be conducted in English only and English will be the means of communication between the students and the instructor. (Students will also be expected to communicate with one another in English.)

2. Students are encouraged to actively participate in class discussions, both independently and collaboratively.

3. This is a COIL (Collaborative Online International Learning) course. COIL courses use Information and Communication Technology (ICT) to connect students in different countries through a combination of synchronous and asynchronous sessions, with the purpose of having students interactively discuss and collaborate on projects and activities designed to expand their knowledge and boost their understanding of various topics. COIL courses help students build various skills. For this particular course, KGU is collaborating with UTAR (Universiti Tunku Abdul Rahman) in Malaysia. At least five out of fourteen session will be conducted in collaboration with the UTAR professor and students. This is a great opportunity for students in Japan to connect and collaborate with students abroad. Join us!
